io.orchestrate.client

Class EventResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.orchestrate.client.EventResource

  • public class EventResource
extends java.lang.Object
    The resource for the event features in the Orchestrate API.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public <T> OrchestrateRequest<EventList<T>> get(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Fetch events for a key in the Orchestrate service.

        Usage:

         EventList<DomainObject> events =
         client.event("someCollection", "someKey")
               .type("eventType")
               .get(DomainObject.class)
               .get();
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type to deserialize the result of the request to.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Type information for marshalling objects at runtime.
        Returns:
        The prepared get request.

      • put

        public OrchestrateRequest<java.lang.Boolean> put(@NonNull
                                        java.lang.Object value)
        put(Object, Long).

      • put

        public OrchestrateRequest<java.lang.Boolean> put(@NonNull
                                        java.lang.Object value,
                                        @Nullable
                                        java.lang.Long timestamp)
        Store an event to a key in the Orchestrate service.

        Usage:

         DomainObject obj = new DomainObject(); // a POJO
 boolean result =
         client.event("someCollection", "someKey")
               .type("someType")
               .put(obj)
               .get();
        Parameters:
        value - The object to store as the event.
        timestamp - The timestamp to store the event at.
        Returns:
        The prepared put request.

      • type

        public EventResource type(java.lang.String type)
        The type for an event, e.g. "update" or "tweet" etc.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of event.
        Returns:
        The event resource.

      • start

        public EventResource start(long start)
        The inclusive start of a time range to query.
        Parameters:
        start - The timestamp to get events from.
        Returns:
        The event resource.

      • end

        public EventResource end(long end)
        The exclusive end of a time range to query.
        Parameters:
        end - The timestamp to get events up to.
        Returns:
        The event resource.
